rationale: 'contagious' is a risk-adjective but is not modified by an intensifier or comparative.
statement_text: Dawn O'Connell, an administrator at the Department of Health and Human Services, said in a press conference May 22 that nearly 5 million doses of a vaccine against H5N1, the bird flu virus circulating in cattle, are being prepared, but that officials have not decided whether the shots will be offered to farmworkers when they're ready later this year.

rationale: The segment does not contain a high-potency verb, potent metaphor, or other Q2 alarmist cue.

rationale: The segment mentions an administrator who 'said' doses 'are being prepared' but officials 'have not decided' whether shots 'will be offered' when they 'are ready', none of which triggers Q3.
